snippet: The appraisal said that the price tag of $2.7 billion to $4.6 billion would never be attained at sale because of factors including donor suits and weakness in the market for some kinds of paintings.
abstract: Expert appraisal of Detroit Institute of Arts' collection finds works could be worth $2.7 billion to $4.6 billion; appraisal, commissioned by city and museum in advance of a federal bankruptcy trial, also notes such a price tag will never be attained at sale because of factors including donor lawsuits and market weakness.
lead_paragraph: The appraisal said that the price tag of $2.7 billion to $4.6 billion would never be attained at sale because of factors including donor suits and weakness in the market for some kinds of paintings.

headline.main: Detroit’s Art May Be Worth Billions, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Detroit’s Art May Be Worth Billions, Report Says
